DOC.detailed_description: Our study design five-arm double blind randomize control trial . In order create blind study , participant three intervention ( Femoral Nerve Block ( FB ) , Periarticular Injection ( PI ) Intrathecal Opioid ( IO ) ) perform visit . Normal saline ( NS ) substitute opioid local anesthetic case control require . Specific 5 arm include : - Using three anesthetic : PI + FB + IO ( arm 1 ) - Using combination two anesthetic + normal saline substitute control : - NS + FB + IO ( arm 2 ) - PI + NS + IO ( arm 3 ) - PI + FB + NS ( arm 4 ) - Control : - NS + NS + IO ( arm 5 ) The control arm would include IO sole intervention simply add spinal anesthetic use surgery . It felt study arm without long-acting analgesic medication ( opioid local anesthetic ) `` control '' arm follow spinal anesthetic would meet current standard care cause harm participant The investigator hypothesize combination three form long acting analgesia ( PI , FB , IO ) result great outcome compare combination two control . Our aim demonstrate optimal analgesic combination additive pain control effect minimize side effect thus translate less acute pain , improve patient mobility , attain `` readiness discharge '' quicker .
